SEARCH
Package gw.api.outboundfile

Interface OutboundFileHandler

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseOutboundFileHandler, BaseOutboundZippedFileHandler
public interface OutboundFileHandler extends Closeable
This is the customer implemented interface to handle OutboundRecord for each OutboundFileConfig there is a baseclass BaseOutboundFileHandler whose open, opens a temp file, and whose close closes that temp file, so you only need to override the process.

IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: this extends Closeable, so you will also have to implement the close method. This must implement a constructor like BaseOutboundFileHandler(entity.OutboundFileConfig)

  • Method Details

    • createFilename

      @NotNull default @NotNull String createFilename(@NotNull @NotNull String batchId)
      This will return a unique filename. This will be combined both the temporary directory and permanent directory

      Implementation Note -- this must be a unique name, if not the batch process will skip this output configuration on this run

      Parameters:
      batchId - this is the formatted string String.format("%s-%s-%s-%d", prefix, name, "yyyyMMddHHmm", sequence);
      Returns:
      a unique filename or the batchId

    • open

      void open(String tempFilePath, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      This is called at the start of processing the batch of records.

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: you are required to maintain this state until close is called. The Base implementation will throw a WrapperException on IOExceptions. As this has specific requirements it is recommended that you extend BaseOutboundFileHandler instead of implementing the interface.

      Parameters:
      tempFilePath - a file path, always provided
      logger - a logger to use for any messages, always provided
      marker - the markers for the logger, always provided

    • process

      void process(OutboundRecord record, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker) throws OutboundFileProcessingException
      For each outbound record this will be called.

      IMPLEMENTORS NOTE: you will write this however you see fit to the temporary file. The Base implementation will throw a WrapperException on IOExceptions

      Parameters:
      record - the record to write, always provided
      logger - a logger for any message, always provided
      marker - the marker for the logger, always provided
      Throws:
      OutboundFileProcessingException - if the record is invalid and should be discarded

    • canView

      default boolean canView(@NotNull @NotNull OutboundRecord record)
      Whether the current user can view the current content

      Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records never contain PII then just return true.

      Parameters:
      record - record
      Returns:
      whether the user can view the content

    • canEdit

      default boolean canEdit(@NotNull @NotNull OutboundRecord record)
      Whether the current user can edit the current content

      Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records do not expose any risk then just return true.

      Parameters:
      record - record
      Returns:
      whether the user can edit the content
